Comment.Language: The following hymn may be said in its tune after the previous hymn or during the Distribution:
The following hymn may also be chanted. This hymn was never recorded or handed down by any cantor and is considered one of the many lost hymns of our church:

Text.Language: Ouciou afsai qen niman~sai: ououro aumacf qen B/yleem: hanmagoc auen dwron naf auhitou: e~q~r/i auouwst m~mof.
A star appeared in the east, a King was born in Bethlehem, and the Magi brought Him offerings, and they bowed down and worshiped Him.
نجم أشرق في المشارق، ملك وُلد في بيت لحم، ومجوس قدموا له قرابين، وخروا وسجدوا له.
Aui~ni naf n~oulibanoc hwc nou]: nem ounoub hwc ouro: nem ousal ef]m/ini: e~pefjinmou n~reftanqo.
They brought Him frankincense as for a Lord, gold as for a king, and myrrh as for His living death.
قدموا له لباناً كإله، وذهباً كملك، ومراً يدل علي موته المحي.
Apen[oic I/couc Pi,~rictoc v/e~tacmacf n~je ]paryenoc qen B/yleem n~te ]Ioudea~ kata nic~m/ m~p~rov/tikon.
Our Lord Jesus Christ, who was born of the Virgin, in Bethlehem of Judea, according to the prophetic voices.
ياربنا يسوع المسيح الذي ولدته العذراء في بيت لحم اليهودية كالأصوات النبوية
